_header: All ghostly songs and hymns that be sung
Subjects: mercy, songs of; God, praise to
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Misericordias Domini in Eternum Cantabo’ — 24 eight-line stanzas with ‘syng’ last word of each stanza

CamJes56.First Lines:
[A]ll goostly songes and ympnes þat be sungeOf olde and newe
                    remembrid in scripture…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…In feith hope and Charite stable as a stoonEternally þi
                    mercies þei do syng

CamTCC601.First Lines:
All gostly songys and hympnes þat be songOf olde and new
                    remembryd in scryptureHeuynly symball or bellys that be rongTo prayse
                    the lord by musyk or mesure…
CamTCC601.Last Lines:
…In feythe hope & Charyte stable as a stoneEternally thy
                    mercyes they do syng
CamTCC601.Attributed Author: John Lydgate (added by later hand, ff. 193v, 196)

BLHar2255.First Lines:
Alle goostly songis & ympnes that be songeOf Oold and newe
                    remembrid in Scripture…
BLHar2255.Last Lines:
…In feith hoope and Charite stable as a stoonEternally thy
                    mercyes they do syng
BLHar2255.Attributed Title: Misericordias domini in eternum cantabo (f. 17, in rubric)
BLHar2255.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 71-7.
